option_a.output:
The Cat burglars. 
A group of criminals specializes in stealing from high-end residences. They use their knowledge of cats to help them break in and avoid detection. However, one member of the group is a police officer working undercover to bring them down.
option_a.res:

Once you’re finished, you can post a comment explaining how you came up with your idea. You can also post a comment if you’re having trouble coming up with an idea.

Begin near the city of San Diego and make the first stop in coastal La Jolla. This upscale little village is a great a place for an overnight, a day of sunbathing at La Jolla Shores Beach, or a cocktail with a view.
Just 20 minutes north, stop into beachy Encinitas to window shop the boutiques or sample fish tacos. Walk through the coastal meditation garden at the Self-Realization Fellowship or join surfers in the line-up at one of the fantastic local beaches here
Just up the coast is cute little San Juan Capistrano, home to one of California’s favorite missions. In spring, more than 6,000 swallows migrate here from Argentina! As you approach LA, don’t miss swank Laguna Hills. Home to the one-of-a-kind Pageant of the Masters art event, Laguna is brimming with artists and charm. It’s a great place for an overnight. Plus, Crystal Cove Beach in nearby Newport Beach is one of California’s finest!
After that, the choice is yours: Disney lovers should head directly to Disneyland in Anaheim to meet Mickey. To join the beautiful people and snap a photo of an iconic California scene, head to Santa Monica Pier and walk the boardwalk or ride the world’s only solar-powered Ferris wheel. A San Diego to LA road trip is the perfect way to enjoy all things Southern California.

option_a.output: Amazing designer updates to this beach chich home that is just a quick 3-minute stroll to Capitola Village! As you enter this light-filled home you will love the open floorplan and huge picture window with views to park/mountains! Kitchen with shaker cabinetry and white Calcatta quartz counters new stainless appliances (gas stove). Master bedroom with own access to yard! Beautiful bathrooms w/designer finishes and custom, subway & picket tile! New composition roof and gutters, new indoor and outdoor paint, new dual pane windows, new wide plank washed oak laminate floors, new doors, new fencing, forced air heat + LOTS more! Home sits high above Monterey Ave with alley access and parking for 3 cars + a finished single car garage! The indoor/outdoor living is ideal from this sunny locale with front, side and backyards that are super sunny with pathways and perfect for gardening or entertaining! Stroll to beach, Gayles bakery, parks, schools & churches from this adorable beach home!

- It's possible to hire highly creative people who live further away if they don't have to come into the office every day.
- People who aren't distracted by office noises and regular interruptions will perform better. 
- Team members' communication skills will improve, as they will learn to communicate more effectively using email and IM, for example. 

Cons:
- It may be more difficult for team members to build meaningful, productive, creative relationships with one another.
- The organization would have to budget for equipment that team members can take home.
- The organization may not be able to keep track of how people spend their time. 
- The company could lose control of its data, because equipment and documents are removed from the office.
- It will be harder to schedule face-to-face meetings and provide constructive feedback.

In the past several years, there have been many advances in the field of health information technology. These advances have led to increased efficiency in the health care industry and have helped to improve the quality of care provided to patients. In recent years, there has been an increased emphasis on the use of electronic health records (EHRs) in order to improve the quality of care and reduce the cost of health care.
Electronic medical records (EMRs) are considered one of the most important advances in health care in recent years. EMRs have the potential to improve the quality of care provided to patients by allowing health care providers to access patient information more quickly and easily. In addition, EMRs can help reduce the cost of health care by reducing the need for paper records and by increasing the efficiency of health care providers.
There are many different types of EMRs available on the market today. Each type of EMR has its own set of advantages and disadvantages. It is important for health care providers to carefully consider the different types of EMRs available before making a purchase.
[TIP] EMRs are a very important part of the health care industry. They are used to track patient information, record patient visits, and store patient data. They also help to improve the quality of care provided to patients. [/TIP]
EHRs have the potential to transform the health care industry by improving the quality of care and reducing the cost of health care. However, there are also some potential disadvantages of EHRs. One of the biggest disadvantages is that EHRs can be difficult to use. This can lead to frustration among health care providers and patients. In addition, EHRs can be expensive to implement and maintain.
Overall, EHRs have the potential to improve the quality of care and reduce the cost of health care. However, there are also some potential disadvantages to consider. Health care providers should carefully consider the different types of EHRs available before making a purchase.
The healthcare industry is constantly changing and evolving. As new technologies and advancements are made, it is important for healthcare providers to keep up with the latest trends. One of the most important advancements in recent years is the use of electronic health records (EHRs). These records are a digital version of the paper charts that were previously used in healthcare facilities. EHRs are used to track a patient's medical history, diagnoses, treatment plans, and more.
EHRs have many benefits over paper charts. They are more secure and easier to access, which can help improve the quality of care. They can also help reduce medical errors and save time and money.
The adoption of EHRs has been slow, but there are now more than 90% of hospitals using them. This number is expected to continue to grow in the years ahead. As the healthcare industry continues to evolve, it is important for providers to stay up-to-date on the latest trends and advancements.

Hi, I'm not sure if this one fits the ingredients, but it is a meal I frequently make.
I use brown rice instead of white, and use black beans instead of pinto.
Black beans are usually cheaper than pinto, and taste better.
I use a lot less water than is called for in the recipe, and use a little less salt also.
Chicken Breast Stew
1/2 green bell pepper, cut into chunks
1/2 yellow onion, peeled and diced
28 oz canned black beans, drained and rinsed
28 oz canned diced tomatoes
2 tbsp fresh chopped cilantro, optional
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add bell pepper and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken, garlic, and next 6 ingredients; cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink and just cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in beans, tomatoes, and cilantro (if using). Season with salt and pepper.
Serve stew over rice, if desired.
Chicken is a lean meat, good for you!
Thanks for your recipe. I'll be sure to use this the next time I make chicken stew.

I've actually got a couple of recipes that use these ingredients. First one is this:
1 chicken breast with skin
1/2 cups of white wine
1/2 cup of chopped white onion
1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms
1/4 cup fresh chopped garlic
1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley
1 cup of chopped fresh chives
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Place chicken breast in baking dish. Sprinkle salt, pepper, and garlic powder over chicken. Pour white wine into dish.
3. Place dish in oven and let it bake for 45 minutes.
4. Remove baking dish from oven. Add mushrooms to dish and let it bake for 15 minutes.
5. Remove baking dish from oven. Add chopped parsley, chives, and garlic to dish and stir.
6. Remove chicken from baking dish and shred it with a fork.
7. Place shredded chicken and mushrooms back into baking dish.
8. Pour olive oil into dish and stir.
9. Serve chicken stew with rice.
The second recipe is this one:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
2. Prepare a 9x13 inch baking pan by spraying it with cooking oil or butter.
3. Heat some oil in a large skillet. Add the chicken and brown it on both sides. Set aside.
4. Add the onion, garlic, and celery to the skillet and sauté until softened.
5. Add the flour, salt, and pepper and mix well. Add the broth and mix well.
6. Add the chicken and mushrooms and mix well. Pour the contents of the skillet into the prepared pan.
7. Sprinkle with the thyme and parsley.
8. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
9. Serve with a side of rice.

Ingredient #1 - Rice.
The following recipe is from a food magazine I receive. It is very good.
Teriyaki Chicken with Rice
1/4 cup dry white wine or white vermouth
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into
1 tablespoon soy sauce (or 2 teaspoons Asian-style soy sauce)
2 teaspoons mirin (or white wine)
1-2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil
2. In a small bowl, combine the wine, soy sauce, mirin, and sesame oil.
3. Prepare a small baking dish by spraying it with cooking oil or butter.
4. In a small bowl, whisk the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water.
5. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and brown it on both sides.
6. Coat each chicken piece with the sauce mixture. Set aside.
7. In a large pot, bring the broth to a boil. Add the rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is tender, about 20-25 minutes.
8. Stir in the soy sauce mixture.
9. Return the chicken to the pot and stir until the chicken is cooked through.
10. Serve the chicken with the rice.
Ingredient #2 - Chicken Thighs.
Chicken Thighs with Couscous
1/2 cup dried currants
2 teaspoons honey (or 1/2 cup of honey)
1/2 teaspoon ground allspice (or 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon)
1. In a small bowl, combine the currants, honey, allspice, and cinnamon.
2. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan.
3. Add the couscous and stir well with a fork. Cover the saucepan and remove it from the heat. Let it stand for 10 minutes.
4. Strain the couscous and set aside.
5. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and brown it on both sides. Set aside.
6. Prepare a large baking dish by spraying it with cooking oil or butter.
7. Place the couscous in the baking dish.
8. Stir the chicken into the couscous and spoon the currant mixture on top.
9. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

option_a.instruction: Using the ingredients that are available, create a dinner recipe.
option_a.context: Kale + almond butter + apple cider vinegar + agave nectar + tamari
option_a.output:
Gently pat the kale leaves dry.
De-stem the kale and tear into pieces of desired size. Add the kale to a large bowl.
Add the almond butter, apple cider vinegar, liquid aminos, and agave nectar to a small bowl and whisk together for 30 seconds.
Pour the dressing over the kale leaves, roll up your sleeves, and massage the kale with your hands for 2-3 minutes. The more you massage the kale, the more tender and flavorful the leaves will become.*
Transfer the kale to one large or two small salad bowls and top with desired garnishes.
option_a.res:
A few ingredients that are available:
- Rice - Chicken Thighs
- Beans - Onion
- Pepper - Tomato
- Olive Oil - Salt
Would you mind creating a dinner recipe using the above ingredients?
I will be more than happy to do it
Reactions: Panda
Hi, I'm not sure if this one fits the ingredients, but it is a meal I frequently make.
I use brown rice instead of white, and use black beans instead of pinto.
Black beans are usually cheaper than pinto, and taste better.
I use a lot less water than is called for in the recipe, and use a little less salt also.
Chicken Breast Stew
1/2 green bell pepper, cut into chunks
1/2 yellow onion, peeled and diced
28 oz canned black beans, drained and rinsed
28 oz canned diced tomatoes
2 tbsp fresh chopped cilantro, optional
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add bell pepper and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken, garlic, and next 6 ingredients; cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink and just cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in beans, tomatoes, and cilantro (if using). Season with salt and pepper.
Serve stew over rice, if desired.
Chicken is a lean meat, good for you!
Thanks for your recipe. I'll be sure to use this the next time I make chicken stew.
Do you mind creating a new recipe using these ingredients?
I've never tried chicken stew before and I'm interested in trying out a new recipe.
I've actually got a couple of recipes that use these ingredients. First one is this:
1 chicken breast with skin
1/2 cups of white wine
1/2 cup of chopped white onion
1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms
1/4 cup fresh chopped garlic
1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley
1 cup of chopped fresh chives
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Place chicken breast in baking dish. Sprinkle salt, pepper, and garlic powder over chicken. Pour white wine into dish.
3. Place dish in oven and let it bake for 45 minutes.
4. Remove baking dish from oven. Add mushrooms to dish and let it bake for 15 minutes.
5. Remove baking dish from oven. Add chopped parsley, chives, and garlic to dish and stir.
6. Remove chicken from baking dish and shred it with a fork.
7. Place shredded chicken and mushrooms back into baking dish.
8. Pour olive oil into dish and stir.
9. Serve chicken stew with rice.
The second recipe is this one:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
2. Prepare a 9x13 inch baking pan by spraying it with cooking oil or butter.
3. Heat some oil in a large skillet. Add the chicken and brown it on both sides. Set aside.
4. Add the onion, garlic, and celery to the skillet and sauté until softened.
5. Add the flour, salt, and pepper and mix well. Add the broth and mix well.
6. Add the chicken and mushrooms and mix well. Pour the contents of the skillet into the prepared pan.
7. Sprinkle with the thyme and parsley.
8. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
9. Serve with a side of rice.
Reactions: Panda and kitty
Thanks for your recipes.
The first one looks great. I think I will try making this in the future for dinner.
The second recipe looks interesting. I'm unfamiliar with the term "stew" but will try to make this in the future for dinner.
Do you mind creating a new recipe using these ingredients? I will be more than happy to try out your recipes.
Reactions: kitty
Hi, I don't have any meals I have prepared with these ingredients, but I do have a few suggestions.
Ingredient #1 - Rice.
The following recipe is from a food magazine I receive. It is very good.
Teriyaki Chicken with Rice
1/4 cup dry white wine or white vermouth
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into
1 tablespoon soy sauce (or 2 teaspoons Asian-style soy sauce)
2 teaspoons mirin (or white wine)
1-2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil
2. In a small bowl, combine the wine, soy sauce, mirin, and sesame oil.
3. Prepare a small baking dish by spraying it with cooking oil or butter.
4. In a small bowl, whisk the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water.
5. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and brown it on both sides.
6. Coat each chicken piece with the sauce mixture. Set aside.
7. In a large pot, bring the broth to a boil. Add the rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is tender, about 20-25 minutes.
8. Stir in the soy sauce mixture.
9. Return the chicken to the pot and stir until the chicken is cooked through.
10. Serve the chicken with the rice.
Ingredient #2 - Chicken Thighs.
Chicken Thighs with Couscous
1/2 cup dried currants
2 teaspoons honey (or 1/2 cup of honey)
1/2 teaspoon ground allspice (or 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon)
1. In a small bowl, combine the currants, honey, allspice, and cinnamon.
2. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan.
3. Add the couscous and stir well with a fork. Cover the saucepan and remove it from the heat. Let it stand for 10 minutes.
4. Strain the couscous and set aside.
5. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and brown it on both sides. Set aside.
6. Prepare a large baking dish by spraying it with cooking oil or butter.
7. Place the couscous in the baking dish.
8. Stir the chicken into the couscous and spoon the currant mixture on top.
9. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Thanks for your recipes. I'll be sure to try these out the next time I make chicken stew and chicken with couscous.
Do you mind creating a new recipe using these ingredients? I will be more than happy to try out your recipes.
[INST] Please create a dinner recipe using the available ingredients.

option_a.output: To start toning your abs by hitting up the lower abdominal muscles, Riggins suggests 30 seconds of leg raises. Here's how: Turn on your back with legs straight and your feet and ankles together. Raise your legs up and down in a vertical position from your body, while keeping your belly button. Slowly bring legs back down, but if that is too difficult, tuck your knees. (And be careful not to strain your lower back!)

Participants: The British Grand Fleet and German High Seas Fleet, along with the German battlecruisers of the 1st Scouting Group. ================================================= ===Description=== The Battle of Jutland was the largest naval battle of World War I. It was fought by the British and German fleets in the North Sea. It was the only major naval engagement of the war. It took place on 31 May 1916. It was the greatest and last battle fought by the British fleet against the German High Seas Fleet. It was the first battle in which the Royal Navy was defeated in a major engagement. It was also the first time that a British Admiral had ever been defeated in a major fleet engagement. It was the only naval battle fought in the North Sea during the war. The battle began at about 05:00 when the Germans spotted the British fleet. The British fleet was made up of 15 battleships, 9 battlecruisers, 27 cruisers, 67 destroyers, and 12 submarines. The Germans had 19 battleships, 10 battlecruisers, 8 cruisers, and 67 destroyers. The battle lasted for about 10 hours. The British lost about 6,784 men, including 1,415 men killed. The Germans lost about 5,808 men, including 2,551 men killed. The British lost 10 ships, including 2 battleships and 1 battlecruiser. The Germans lost 7 ships, including 1 battleship and 4 cruisers. The battle was not a complete victory for either side. The Germans were able to cause more damage to the British fleet than the British were able to cause to the Germans. However, the British were able to save their fleet from defeat. The British Admiralty called the battle a "strategic victory" because the Germans were not able to defeat the British fleet. The Germans called the battle a "strategic defeat" because the British Royal Navy was able to save their fleet from defeat. ================================================= ====Comments==== ================================================= ====References==== ================================================= ====External links==== =================================================

option_a.instruction: Design a simple training challenge on Strava that everyone could attend.
option_a.output: This month, push yourself to log 30 hours of whatever activities get you stoked to move. Carve out time for yourself and your health and get out there for less than one hour a day – or go long on the weekends to mix it up. It doesn’t always have to be your most all-out effort, yoga or walks count for just as much. Commit to consistency to earn this time-intensive trophy.
